articles.author: Rhiannon Hoyle
articles.title: Countries Push to Extract More Cash from Big Mining Companies
articles.description: As gold, diamond and copper values grow, governments are demanding Western mine operators pay higher royalties and taxes, process commodities locally and cede control of mines.
articles.content: From Congolese jungles to Indonesian highlands, a struggle is raging between governments and major mining companies over control of commodities vital to the production of everything from steel to electric cars to smartphones. Developing-world leaders, spurred… [+14754 chars]

articles.author: Dominique Fong
articles.title: China Pushes Modern Farming as Tariffs Make U.S. Crops Costlier
articles.description: Chinese agriculture is dominated by small farms with low crop yields, and the trade fight between the U.S. and China is giving Beijing fresh incentive to overhaul the sector as tariffs on American crops make those imports more expensive.
articles.content:
YANGXIN COUNTY, ChinaTo keep bugs from spoiling her wheat and corn, Wei Junxia walks her plot of land spraying pesticide from a container on her back. A neighbor uses an even simpler tool
                to boost production: a plastic tube jammed into a bag of fertilizer tha…[+4981 chars]

articles: Many firefighters battling California’s deadliest wildfire in Paradise have spent the past year hopping from one major blaze to another—each worse than the last.
articles.content: PARADISE, Calif.Many firefighters battling Californias deadliest wildfire in Paradise have spent the past year hopping from one major blaze to anothereach worse than the last. Now with this months Camp Fire, which has claimed at least 76 lives, burned 149,500… [+3484 chars]

articles.author: Ted Mann
articles.title: GE Seeks Power Sales in Iraq, But Report Spotlights Corruption Concerns
articles.description: General Electric is seeking sales for struggling power unit, but faces a dilemma with Iraq, according to a consultant’s report prepared for the company. The nation needs multi-million dollar gas turbines—and poses corruption problems.
articles.content: General Electric Co. learned from a consultants report this past summer of corruption allegations against key business partners in Iraq, where the company is trying to shore up its position in one of the most important foreign markets for its struggling power… [+6989 chars]

articles.author: Akane Otani
articles.title: Why the Corporate Earnings Boom Has Failed to Lift Investors’ Spirits
articles.description: Many on Wall Street are weathering the fall technology rout by buying shares of firms with slower, steadier earnings growth, the latest sign that investors largely remain sanguine about U.S. stocks despite recent reversals.
articles.content: Many on Wall Street are weathering the autumn technology rout by buying the shares of firms with slower, steadier earnings growth, the latest sign that investors largely remain sanguine about U.S. stocks despite recent reversals. Trading has turned rocky sinc… [+4444 chars]

articles.title: John Bolton Energizes Trump’s Agenda—And His Own
articles.description: With a centralized decision-making style, national security adviser John Bolton pushes President Trump’s initiatives while pursuing policy priorities he has long advocated as a government official and commentator.

articles.title: Beauty and the Backlash: Disney’s Modern Princess Problem
